body:
### Problem

I was just testing a chinese version of my plugin when i noticed that when i have my terminal opened in a bigger window, neovim crashes while trying to open a new question. This doesn't happen when i use the non chinese version (without chinese characters). 

There are few similar issues marked as "fixed", yet it still happens.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/69250723/13ae2c9a-d0c0-46b4-9264-d42f0360f7c7



### Steps to reproduce

`leetcode.nvim` plugin with `cn` version enabled

### Expected behavior

.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.0-dev-2049+gf5d420d61

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

can't test because lua is needed

### Operating system/version

6.6.10-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.31.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body: Please try to get backtrace by referring to: https://neovim.io/doc/user/dev_tools.html#dev-tools-backtrace or have [a minimal reproduction](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/contrib/minimal.lua) of the bug.

```lua
local root = vim.fn.fnamemodify("./.repro", ":p")

for _, name in ipairs({ "config", "data", "state", "cache" }) do
	vim.env[("XDG_%s_HOME"):format(name:upper())] = root .. "/" .. name
end

local lazypath = root .. "/plugins/lazy.nvim"
if not vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath) then
	vim.fn.system({ "git", "clone", "--filter=blob:none", "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git", lazypath })
end
vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath)

local plugins = {}

local leetnvim = {
	"kawre/leetcode.nvim",
	build = ":TSUpdate html",
	dependencies = {
		"nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim",
		"nvim-lua/plenary.nvim",
		"MunifTanjim/nui.nvim",
		"nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter",
	},
	opts = {
		cn = { enabled = true },
	},
}

table.insert(plugins, leetnvim)
require("lazy").setup(plugins, {
	root = root .. "/plugins",
})
```

to open `leetcode.nvim` you would need to pass `leetcode.nvim` as the neovim arg. So something like this
```
nvim -u repro.lua leetcode.nvim
```

you would also need to sign-in with a `leetcode.cn` account. If that's a problem i can share a cookie from my account which i use solely for testing.

this assertion work with debug build type. could you try build with release type ?   and this is not a minimal reproduce step
Yes, i just tested it and it works on `Release`, but `Debug` and `RelWithDebInfo` crashes the same way as presented in the video
It may be better if you type `bt` at the GDB prompt to get a backtrace with argument values.

Hmm, the crash seems to depend on terminal size. What is the size of the terminal (e.g. "rows" and "columns" printed by `stty -a`) when the crash happened?
If i do `rows 47; columns 180` it doesn't crash
`rows 52; columns 194` is the spot. If i go above or below it doesn't crash.
Oh I can reproduce this. Double-width chars and vertical separator are enough to reproduce the crash.
